note_tsim: Eight coastal views of eastern Nova Scotia.
Appears in the author's Atlantic Neptune. London : J.F.W. Des Barres, 1777-[1781].
dcMetadata.extent_tsi: 8 views on 1 sheet : hand col. ; sheet 81 x 117 cm.
dcMetadata.abstract_tsi: This grouping of eight headland views paints a striking picture of the Nova Scotia coast, east of Halifax. Covering a geographic area from Beaver Harbour northeast to Milford Haven (a distance of 160 miles), these coastal profiles served a utilitarian purpose for mariners navigating the complicated Nova Scotia coastline. Artistic elements such as foreboding skies and ships mooring in the port were added for aesthetic appeal; however, the coastal representations themselves were provided for navigational purposes. These views are a major advance over the earlier, unsophisticated headland views available to navigators in such works as the English Pilot.
dcMetadata.publisher_tsi: Published according to Act of Parliament J.F.W. Des Barres
